alert.note: Alert for Hartford (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 1:35PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Thunderstorms with torrential rainfall will move into the Hartford-Springfield area through 230 PM... At 131 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of thunderstorms extending from near Amherst MA southward to near Litchfield CT. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. These thunderstorms were producing very heavy rainfall. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, New Britain, West Hartford, Bristol, Chicopee, Enfield, Southington, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Newington, Windsor, Northampton, Agawam, West Springfield, Farmington, Deerfield, Simsbury and Ludlow. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.
